        • controller

      • loadRoot

        public static void loadRoot(Object rootController)
        Loads the <class name>.fxml file, where <class name> is the type of the specified rootController and the FXML-file is expected to be in the same package.

        Sets:
        • the ClassLoader to the ClassLoader of the specified type
        • the root
        • the controller
        • the ResourceBundle by looking for a <name>.properties file, where <name> is equal to the name of the type of the rootController (or a locale specific derivation using the default Locale)
        • the location to the FXML file
        The root element of the FXML document is expected to be:

        <fx:root type="{super-type}" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml">

        where "super-type" is the super type of the type of the specified rootController.
        Parameters:
        rootController - the Object acting as the root and as the controller.

      • loadRoot

        public static void loadRoot(FXMLLoader loader,
                            Object rootController)
        Loads the <class name>.fxml file, where <class name> is the type of the specified rootController and the FXML-file is expected to be in the same package.

        Sets:
        • the root
        • the controller
        • the ResourceBundle by looking for a <name>.properties file, where <name> is equal to the name of the specified type (or a locale specific derivation using the default Locale)
        • the location to the FXML file
        The root element of the FXML document is expected to be:

        <fx:root type="{super-type}" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml">

        where "super-type" is the super type of the specified type.

        TODO: needed?
        Parameters:
        loader - the FXMLLoader
        rootController - the Object acting as the root and as the controller.
        See Also:
        resetFXMLLoader(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader)

      • loadRoot

        public static void loadRoot(Object rootController,
                            ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Loads the <class name>.fxml file, where <class name> is the type of the specified rootController and the FXML-file is expected to be in the same package.

        Sets:
        • the ClassLoader to the ClassLoader of the specified type
        • the root
        • the controller
        • the ResourceBundle to the specified resourceBundle
        • the location to the FXML file
        The root element of the FXML document is expected to be:

        <fx:root type="{super-type}" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml">

        where "super-type" is the super type of the type of the specified rootController.
        Parameters:
        rootController - the Object acting as the root and as the controller.
        resourceBundle - the ResourceBundle the FXMLLoader should use.

      • loadRoot

        public static void loadRoot(FXMLLoader loader,
                            Object rootController,
                            ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Loads the <class name>.fxml file, where <class name> is the type of the specified rootController and the FXML-file is expected to be in the same package.

        Sets:
        • the root
        • the controller
        • the ResourceBundle to the specified resourceBundle
        • the location to the FXML file
        The root element of the FXML document is expected to be:

        <fx:root type="{super-type}" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml">

        where "super-type" is the super type of the type of the specified rootController.
        Parameters:
        loader - the FXMLLoader
        rootController - the Object acting as the root and as the controller.
        resourceBundle - the ResourceBundle the FXMLLoader should use.
        See Also:
        resetFXMLLoader(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader)

      • load

        public static <T> T load(Class<?> type)
        Loads the <class name>.fxml file, which is expected to be in the same package as the specified type.

        Sets:
        • the ClassLoader to the ClassLoader of the specified type
        • the ResourceBundle by looking for a <name>.properties file, where <name> is equal to the name of the specified type (or a locale specific derivation using the default Locale)
        • the location to the FXML file
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the root element
        Parameters:
        type - the type
        Returns:
        the loaded object
        See Also:
        resetFXMLLoader(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader)

        Sets:

        • the location to the FXML file
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        loader - the FXMLLoader
        type - the type
        Returns:
        the loaded object
        See Also:
